questions.question: Are the black-and-white half-timbered gable ends visible and positioned at the top of the central and right-side sections of the building?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the edited image includes three framed versions of a building with distinct black-and-white half-timbered architectural features at the top of the central and right sections. These structures are commonly associated with Tudor-style architecture, where the exposed timber provides a clear visual outline against the white plaster, indicating specific design elements like gable ends.

questions.question: Is there a black arched door located on the left side of the building, embedded within the brick wall below the window ledge?
questions.explanation: Image B presents multiple instances of the same building, all showing an arched black door on the left side, set within a brick wall. Such doors are typically used in older architectural styles for aesthetic and structural reasons, and they are located below window ledges to maintain symmetry in the design.

questions.question: Is the sign reading "Leeds Parkway Hotel" present beneath the entrance awning, aligned horizontally above the main doors?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the first framed version of the building includes a sign that reads 'Leeds Parkway Hotel' positioned horizontally beneath the awning above the entrance. It is customary for hotel signage to be clearly visible above main doors, ensuring easy identification for guests.

questions.question: Are there rectangular planters with colorful flowers positioned along the base of the building, both in front of the black arched door and near the entrance steps?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the edited images show planters filled with colorful flowers set in a straight line along the base of the building, including areas near the black arched door and entrance steps. Such placements are typical in enhancing the aesthetic appeal and welcoming environment of public buildings.

questions.question: Are there multiple windows with white frames arranged in grid patterns, including dormer windows on the roof and a bay window on the right side of the building?
questions.explanation: Within the edited representations in Image B, all versions illustrate grid-patterned window designs with white frames, featuring dormer windows protruding from the roof and a bay window on the building's right side. These elements are common in residential architecture that aims to maximize natural light and space.

questions.question: Are the main entrance doors located centrally under the awning, consisting of two wooden doors with glass panels?
questions.explanation: Image B displays multiple angles where central entrance doors are aligned under the awning. These consist of two wooden doors with glass panel inserts, a design often used in entranceways to enhance visibility while maintaining a sturdy structure.

questions.question: Is the lower section of the building constructed from red brick, with an arched opening housing the black door?
questions.explanation: All edited images in Image B show the lower section of the building composed of red brick, which includes an arched opening accommodating the black door. This construction method is prevalent in structures designed for durability, maintaining a classic aesthetic appeal.
